FuncDef:
The mpls oam command globally enables MPLS OAM.
The undo mpls oam command disables MPLS OAM.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, MPLS OAM is globally disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the LSP ID field in MPLS OAM packets complies with standard mode. If this parameter is not specified, the LSP ID field in MPLS OAM packets complies with compatibility mode.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
MPLS OAM is a fault detection mechanism used at the MPLS network layer. MPLS OAM provides the following functions:
Effectively detects, identifies, and locates faults at the MPLS network layer.Quickly switches traffic if links or nodes fail to reduce the fault duration and improve network reliability.
MPLS OAM can be configured to monitor the connectivity of LSPs and PWs and trigger tunnel switchovers. Before configuring MPLS OAM functions, you must run the mpls oam command to globally enable MPLS OAM.

Prerequisites
The MPLS view has been displayed using the mpls command.
Precautions
After the undo mpls oam command is run, all MPLS OAM configurations are deleted.
Both MPLS OAM and BFD or MPLS-TP OAM cannot be configured for the same TE tunnel or CR-LSP.
